name: Joshua Schwartz (BloodPoolBoy)
text: The reviews were right. They don't even answer the phone

name: Liz Fields
text:
I was going to immediately post a review because I was so angry when we picked our RV up from them but I waited and did my research (which I should have done before I used them) and now I am posting my review. My husband and I are fulltime RV'ers so our RV is our home and my husband travels for work. So when we found out that our exhaust manifold was cracked we needed someone quickly. So without proper research we took it to these guys. They gave us a crazy estimate but was told that it was JUST an estimate, that it really depended on how hard the exhaust manifold was to remove and if any bolts broke as they were removing it. We dropped it off on a Thursday morning at 8:00 a.m. On Monday at noon my husband was informed that the parts were still not in. Then on Monday at 4:00 p.m. my husband was told that it was ready to be picked up. Since we were over an hour away we told them we would pick it up on Tuesday. My husband was also told that the final bill was $2,990.00. WHAT??? We were flabbergasted because they had told my husband that the exhaust manifold came off easy and that no bolts had broken. My husband talked to the service manager and disputed the bill but the service manager would not budge so in order to get our RV back we had to pay it. Then I did my research and talked to several other diesel mechanics and also talked with some other freightliner and cummins mechanics and was told that they seriously overcharged us for the work that is shown on the bill. The bill states the following "Pulled unit in shop. removed turbo and exhaust manifold. Cleaned the head and the turbo. Installed and torqued new exhaust manifold and turbo with all new gaskets and bolts. Cleaned inside and out. Ran unit. Checked for leaks none found. Parked unit." They charged us $175.00 an hour and claimed 14 hours worth of work for a total labor cost of $2,450.00. No mention of any problems whatsoever in removing the exhaust manifold. In my talks with other diesel mechanics I was quoted anywhere from $1,200.00 to at the most (from another freightliner mechanic) $125.00 an hour for labor. And that it should not have taken 14 hours to do the job if there had been no problems. Another mechanic I spoke with said that if the parts were not there at noon but it was finished at 4:00 then it took them at the most 4 hours to "install and torque the new manifold and turbo with all new gaskets and bolts. Clean inside and out. Run unit. Check for leaks and park the unit." That would leave 10 hours for them to remove the exhaust manifold and that is overboard, especially since there were no issues in removing it. I was given some great advice and I am pursuing this. I was told that in order to hold the Freightliner name that they have to abide by a "Labor Guide" and to ask to see it (but we had already paid and picked the RV up so I was too late in doing that) so I have requested the labor guide requirements for this type of job. I have also requested quotes from other diesel mechanics based on what they said they did via the bill. And have contacted the main Freightliner offices. It is sad that we as consumers can not completely trust that we won't be screwed when we take our property to people.
On top of all of the above, when we were ready to leave my husband asked for the key and lo and behold they had lost it. They could not find the key to our RV. Really?? What kind of business that works on vehicles loses keys? It was a good thing that we had another key with us. I would recommend to do your research before you make a quick decision like we did.

text: Very low key Frightliner. They did get a good price on a radiator.

name: Casey Tarantino
text: I don’t want to give them one star. They hurt us financially in the worst way. They are liars and thieves. My husband went to work for WTI in Alabama. Their repair shop is in cahoots with the Freightliner in the same town of Tuscaloosa. Just after a 90 day inspection my husband switched to WTI. They immediately on first day said there he needed over 6000.00 in repairs on his truck. We had no choice st the moment but to get it repaired where he could start work. Freightliner started repair on it. Finished it in THREE WEEKS!! So my husband was out of work for over 4 weeks due to this scam. After he was up & running again here in Pensacola we had to put it in the shop at Freightliner. After a week they found out that none of the parts had been replaced or were either old parts. It took another week to get it approved to not have to pay for the parts and labor on what was done! Then the manager in Pensacola found out that the Work was not even done by a licensed Mechanic in Tuscaloosa!!  Then of course the Pensacola Freightliner found some more things wrong of course. Like they always do. Sigh * we were out of work over 6 weeks due to this. I contacted the owner of the three Freightliner owned by him. One in Tuscaloosa and two in Atlanta area. He wouldn’t call me back at all. If we had had the money and time we would’ve had an attorney. Stay away from WTI in Tuscaloosa & FREIGHTLINER in Tuscaloosa. For the most parts there are is a lot of crookedness at Freightliners some more than others but TUSCALOOSA is the worst!! STAY AWAY!!!

text: I had a fairly decent experience. Wayne did a good job of taking care of me and my interest. text: Great place, great people! Tellis was very helpful in getting me in the best car possible. I highly recommend.

name: Jacy Hopkins
text: My husband and I were preapproved through a lender and we started shopping for vehicles. We drove almost 100 miles to test drive a 2014 Honda Pilot, decided we liked it, our lender sent the paperwork to the dealership, “Big Al” said the title person was gone for today and he would email us anything we needed to sign in the morning, not to worry the vehicle was ours and wasn’t going to be sold to anyone. The next day rolls around and we cannot get in touch with Al. Our lender cannot get in touch with Al. Finally later in the afternoon the lender gets in touch with him and he says he’s going to get the paperwork (bill of sale and signed 30 day warranty guarantee) sent over which he doesn’t do until the following day. We sign all necessary paperwork with the lender and call to let Al know they would be sending a check at the beginning of the week as he pushed back the paperwork until late Friday afternoon, we can’t get him on the phone. Try to reach him again on Saturday and can’t get him on the phone. Try to reach him again Monday and I’m sure you know how it goes at this point. The lender says they are sending a check out today. We call and can’t get Al again so we call the dealership directly to find out that they sold the car out from underneath us because Al claimed he had no heard from us or the lender and couldn’t get in touch with us. Mind you I already purchased insurance for this vehicle which Geico is now charging me to cancel the policy on. Highly disappointed in the lack of professionalism. Would not recommend this dealer to absolutely anyone. You’re better off taking your hard earned money somewhere else and spending it.

name: Brianna Johnson

name: Chasity Cox
text: After the run around looking for dependable transportation i found myself at suncoast. The salesperson tommie was very helpful with getting me into a car. I started having problems with the car the following month of actually getting the car. The owner was very rude about having to fix the car (that was never fixed from the start because it was in the back of the lot right off of a truck that brought cars in). 5 days After taking my car back to be fixed because my hood wouldnt close it turned out to be more problems with the car than expected. The owner complained about how much money he had to put into getting the car fixed which wasn't my fault. I made him aware that this was the only transportation and that my kids had missed the entire week of school and he said "well! U asked us to fix the car so we are fixing it" after my husband heard how i was being spoken to on the phone by the owner he told the owner that he didnt appreciate the way he was speaking to me. The owner then called the finance company and purchased the car back from them while the car was in his possession without letting me know what was happening. After calling from several different numbers (because they would no longer answer for mine) i finally spoke with the owner and he was extremely rude and my husband over heard the conversation and intervened letting the owner know that he wouldn't talk to me in that manor. Even After apologizing for him being rude to me or what he thought was getting smart with him he pretty much told me it was nothing he could do about my down payment or the payments I've made towards purchasing the vehicle. The owner is very unprofessional and rude he is not sympathetic with anyone and if i could give this car lot 0 stars i would. I would never recommend anyone that i know to this car lot they are a scam not to mention I've had the car since march and never recieved my tag paper work so I'm stuck paying tickets for a car i no longer have and EVERYTHING that has happened is because of suncoast unprofessional owner and the scams that he pull. I hope the next mother that is working hard to take care of her kids will read this and not waste money with these clowns because if u let them they'll take advantage of u too and take all out your money leaving u and kids stranded while they get richer off of messing over kind people.

text: the folks at Sun Coast City are wonderful!  so easy to deal with and work to get me the car I wanted.  I would highly recommend them!  Great selection and many financing options.  No need to go anywhere else - they take great care of their customers!!!

name: Sheena Marie
text:
Just spoke to the owner who after telling me he would not be sending someone to help me with a car that broke down in less than 60 days  hung up in my face.

I called to inform them that the car was not cranking and I had just paid the first car note.  He said he would send someone to jump me off and nothing else. I asked would the problem be fixed and he said they could inspect it for $75.  I explained to him that I didn’t understand why I would have to pay. He then informed me of how I should have inspected the car myself and that he would not send anyone and hung up.

When I purchased the car I was told that they had just gotten the car but now they want me to pay them to do something that should have been done!

I am still wondering why this car wasn’t inspected  before the car left the lot!

There is a such thing as bad business practices and unethical business.
I am a single mother who trusted the wrong car lot.

name: Christina Kunde
text: the folks at Sun Coast City are wonderful!  so easy to deal with and work to get me the car I wanted.  I would highly recommend them!  Great selection and many financing options.  No need to go anywhere else - they take great care of their customers!!!

text: It was horrible I won't refer anyone there ! I had put money down and the employee told me I could bring $700 back instead of $1000 so when it was all said and done after having the car for a week they took it when I came to pay the $700 and made me and my 1 year old stand In the heat for over a hour I wouldn't be upset if it would have been just me ! I even asked them to bring me close to home which was 35 minutes away ! Needless to say this company sucks. Oh and also was reading the reviews and someone faked my middle name and gave them a 5 star rating ! Negative rating DEFINITELY ! has been reported.

name: Chase Spitzkopf
text: Unfortunately one star is being given where credit is not due...in reality this company earns a negative five stars. Excellent model for HOW NOT TO RUN A SMALL BUSINESS. However, if you are searching for a previously auctioned, molested, sketchy scratch and dent daily driver for 10-20% over NADA this is a wonderful place to consider. Customer service is a foreign language for these people. They don't give two ***** about you, and rightfully so (being business people) but they could at least attempt to. A salesman actually posted positive reviews to mitigate the negatives. Do yourself a favor and steer clear, just my $0.02.

name: Benjamin Smith
text: How do places like this stay in business? Looks like the few positive reports they received were employees posing as customers. (Henry & Parrish )  Bought a car on a Saturday evening. They promised to repair before I signed final paperwork.  After I took car home, salesman never would return calls. Since no one will call me back I decide to wait until someone does call me to go back and sign final paperwork. Finally, 3 weeks later the owner calls accusing me of avoidiing them! I was irate, told him I've been waiting on salesman or anyone for that matter to return my call. Tell him I still want car If they want to sell it as long as fender is repaired    Of course he takes employee side and says I never called and they never promised to fix anything. At this point I just wanted to return car, he said I could but then they would not return my down payment. Basically they robbed me. Buyer Beware. Avoid this place like the plague !! Where's Donald Trump when you need him ?

Not only that they lied about the contract and I had to pay extra than what I agreed on. Worst dealership ever! Never do business here.

I bought my car from Chris and he was great. We had a small issue with the windshield wipers and set an appointment and they fixed it right away.

It's nice to know they do what they say they are going to do!

text: Tommy is a great sales man and the owner was fabulous with us. Definatley coming back to purchase another car later.

name: FBA Forget Being Average
text: Do not I repeat do not buy any vehicles from this car lot. Just from my last visit there they have car salesmans in the office cousin out loud yelling across the room to one another which this is supposed to be a place of business not the ghetto. Very unprofessional people including the owner. My wife and I purchased a truck from this dealership it had issues that they promised to fix. We brought the truck back as instructed. They didn't have time to fix everything so the owner told my wife to bring it back but when we try to bring it back he tried to charge us for Diagnostics as if the old problems were already fixed when they were not fixed we did not need another diagnostic considering the old issues were never completed in the first place so he wanted to charge us for Diagnostics and charge us for the work. In the beginning we were told we would only have to pay for the parts. If they tell you they're going to do something make sure you get them to put it in writing because they will go back on their word I can assure you of that.

name: Anthony BAZZEL
text: I have nothing but good things to say about my experience at Suncoast. I still cant understand how they were able to secure my car loan, with the credit issues I brought to the table. I am now the proud owner of a 2013 Nissan Altima and I love it! If you need a vehicle I would definitely go see them.

text: Tim is awesome !!! Was in and out in less then an hour !! Iwill be back

text:
I recently purchased a BMW from Suncoast and had a great experience.

I had some credit issues but they were able to get me financing and deliver the car to me the same day!

I would recommend them!

name: Mary Dailey
text: Horrible business. They are professional scam artists and try to take advantage of you in every way possible, from hiding the immense issues with the cars to putting USED tires on the brand new overpriced car you just bought.  Why would you replace used tires with used tires? The tires on the car bought were bald, with written intentions that Suncoast would replace the tires AND get the car a much needed alignment. They lied about the alignment and then put used tires on it. "Your safety is our priority, we'll fix it."....After 6+ months, that promise  has not been honored. Phone calls are not returned, the people in the building are disrespectful. Also, it's childish to try to cover up your bad reviews, own up to your scam tactics and fix yourself before you go out of business. To those of you who are looking to purchase a car, stay VERY far away from this place...with all due respect.

name: marcus Williams
text: I love this Honda Accord i got, and the best salesmen Duncan and Bendolph. They hooked me up and gave me a chance, when nobody else would.

name: Diam0nd Sakura
text: I purchased a vehicle from this place last year and found out the truth behind it after i hit a minor pothole. THE CAR HAD BEEN IN A PREVIOUS WRECK NOT ONCE BUT TWICE. The saleman failed to offer me a carfax up front like most dealer do now. After i found out it was wrecked i told them about it and they it was nothing they could do. I could not trade it in or switch out the car. After they found out about it, they blame the auction where they purchase the car from which was Texas Motors. After been inspected by a collision company they discovered that it had poor body work under the so called "good paint job". The car looked good, But it was under all that what was hiding. Took it to FORD and they couldn't even activated the airbags because the control panel was tricked. All Parrish (THE INTERNET GUY) could say was "i dont know anything about the cars someone else does that, I just sale them". The car suppose to been totled out but wasn't. I had to surrender it cause no one would take it. But in the end I got a better car, for a price FROM ANOTHER DEALER. Will never bring my love ones here NEVER. I pray god corrects their blindsided ways.

name: David Tipton
text: Was a horrible experience. Please do not go there. I am warning everyone. They are sketchy from the start. They will continue to be sketchy till its all over. I was working on my loan with the company they approved me with. Talked to a lady with the loan to finish up paperwork and Suncoast sent a repo. Weeks before I even had a payment due. Tried to keep my downpayment. They charged me 200 for repo that shouldn't even of been repoed. Recommend definitely looking around at other dealerships. I have had way better luck with ano the dealer that took care of the problems with the vehicle I now have.

name: marcus Williams
text: I love this Honda Accord i got, and the best salesmen Duncan and Bendolph. They hooked me up and gave me a chance, when nobody else would.

name: Lina Manning
text: What a joke of a manager. My car sales man was really nice. I decided not to buy the car which put me on a rental status. The car I was looking at buying had an exhaust leak, it had been in a front end collision and was falling apart. The work that needed to be done was not a issue. When I went in to get my money back the manager Tony took his sweet time in getting to me and was really rude about it. I brought the car back yesterday at 8:15 am and it was 2:30 by the time he decided he would deal with me. He charged me 100$ for 2 days that I didnt even have the car fully (picked it up monday night close to closing and returned yesterday at opening). He told me in the middle of fighting with him about the days that "this country has laws" which obviously. He fought with me about paying me back my money when I hadnt even signed the purchase agreement. He told me I was lucky he wasnt charging me for gas, to have it cleaned and washed. I received the car with no gas in it at all and it was dirty. There were mold spores growing on the roof and the roof was cracked on the exterior. Functions in the car didnt work properly and the transmission was on its way out. The brakes had two inches of play in them. 5 miles down the road the service light had come on and the car started shifting funny. Took it to Advanced Auto and had them hook it up. It gave a malfunction code. Which I didnt stress cause it had gone away within a hour, but had called about it. They had lost the keys to it but did have 2 new keys made. The manager of this place is extremely rude, especially towards women. I had raised my voice and told him it was BS that he was charging me for days I didnt have the car and that I had to wait 6.5 hours for him to cut me a check back of my own money. He threw me out of his office after I had to fight the check out of him. This is a place I will never do business. I have never met someone so rude in customer service and called him out on it. I lost 322.56 to this guy and he told me he wasnt making a dime. Looks to me like he made a few hundred. I dont have a issue paying what I needed to pay but I do have a issue of paying for days that the car was not in a possession for the full day. I would have payed less at a car rental company instead of 50$ a day and .36 a mile. This place is highway robbery. They wanted 22k for a 2007 Ford Explorer Eddie Bauer Edition with 122k on it that was falling apart. Good thing my husband had no interest in buying this vehicle and we returned it. I couldnt imagine being locked down to this guy for the next 4 years. My recommendation is to not do business with this company solely do to the guy who manages it and he will rip you off. He treats his own employees like crap. The only reason they got 1 star is because not possible to leave it blank.

name: Anna Shultz
text: DO NOT GO HERE!!!!!! The people seem friendly at first until something goes wrong!!!!!! I got a 2010 kia from here and it's a peice of crap!!!! None of their cars are detailed, the kia has high mileage, i'm paying wayy too much for it, i've already had to call a lawyer to them and i JUST got the car!!!
