name: Amy B
text: We were very disappointed. The salesman seemed willing to work with us, but the big boss only offered $50 off of a used trailer, when the salesman had already offered lower than that. We have great credit and were willing to buy today. Dan was very nice, but we will keep looking. Thank you. If they had even honored the price that the salesman offered, we would have bought it. The price was never an issue and we wound up spending $3,000 more at another dealer for exactly what I truly wanted, but the attitude of the owner and way they renigged on the original offer they made us while trying to make it sound like we "turned down" the offer--no thanks! Making an offer or saying "would you take $200 less" is not turning down anything. I will never recommend this dealer, especially with so many other great places around.  I am glad I was able to see the owners attitude up front and was able to find a truly fantastic dealer I am happy to send friends to.

resp.text: Amy, I’m sorry I could not reduce the trailer price to suit you. I promise I will not be mad with you because you would not pay what I am asking for it. I do appreciate the opportunity, and I wish you the very best in finding the right one for you!  Don

I wouldn't recommend anyone here

resp.text: Amber, I am so sorry you missed the trailer.  All trailers are for sale until we actually have an approved application in hand or unless we have a non refundable deposit in hand.  Your application was declined by the bank, than a note was sent to you asking if you possibly had a co signer.  Before you responded back, another customer came in with cash and bought the trailer.  At any one time, we have around 10 or 12 credit applications pending on different trailers.  At times we have more than one application on the same trailer.  Again, I'm sorry you missed it, and we really appreciate the opportunity!  Thanks DON

text:
Owner, Don, is unprofessional and hung up on me. when I spoke to another employee, he tried to intimidate me, then he hung up on me as well. If you want to be treated with respect and curtousy as a customer, don't go to this place! I was shocked!
UPDATE: I edited this review after reading the owner's totally untrue response. I never asked that my trailer be repaired to "perfect" condition, as he says. Also, it took over two weeks JUST to get a response from him about my repairs. I had to call to even get him to respond to my first email. Also, NOTHING in his response explained why he and another employee so rudely hung up on me. I guess you can read all his other responses and see for yourself that he takes zero responsibility for his own actions and blames the customer when they have a terrible experience.

resp.text: Ms Barbara, I'm sorry you feel this way.  After many days here with my service manager trying to help you out with your repairs, and having made many calls on your behalf, and agreeing to work your trailer in to do the repairs, it became evident to us, through our communications with you via email, that we were not going to be able to meet your demands as to restoring your trailer to perfect condition, nor are we able to keep your trailer under shelter while in our possession, so I decided it would be best if we did not do the repairs.  I politely advised you of this today, and recommended you locate a shop that could do these things for you.  There are times and circumstances in which it's best not to do business.  This is one of those times.  I certainly hold no animosity toward you, but it's evident you do toward us, and are seeking a pound of flesh.  There is no call for rudeness on your part, and there certainly won't be any on mine.  You are free to do business with whom you choose, as am I.  DON SMITH, OWNER, DHMCO

name: Jordan Dumas
text:
This place is named the Best Auto Sales but it should be changed. I will never attempt to buy from here again, and no one else should either. I live in Montgomery, and drove here to find a car for a relative. We were told by Jimmy that he would update us on a particular car that we were interested in that was supposed to be coming in (which he also recommended to us). After driving around and wasting more than enough time here, we were told to come back another time, under the impression that the car we were promised we arrive and that he would let us know about. We needed this car ASAP, so of course we did. Days went by, and come to find out Jimmy had lied to us and told us that the car never arrived. However, it did and he wanted to either save the car for himself or for someone else. I will NEVER spend a dime here and I will continue to leave bad reviews. We ended up buying from a GREAT dealership in Montgomery (Jack Ingram Used Cars) and I recommend you all buy from the salesman Craig.

Also, don't quote this trying to call and 'work it out'. Don't ever contact me again.

text: I just made a previous review about my service at this location. While sitting in my vehicle talking to the salesman Jimmy with minor child waiting on a friend Ms Cathy bust out the door shouting again that my post was ridiculous and their taking their car back. I’m not sure what this individual has against me personally but all i wanted was a functioning vehicle. I don’t think i deserve to be humiliated like this in front of my child. I pulled down the street to comfort my child because at this point she was crying and Ms. Cathy just called me screaming and shouting and threatening to repo my car because of my review. Is this really how you treat customers, is this fair to me. Can you really just bully a single parent in the rain.. i just don’t know what else to do at this point. And the before she hung up she told me the owner was unavailable to speak with me just bring back the car...

name: Casey Thompson
text: They do have nice cars and a lot to choice from. The only issue I'v had with them is their pricing. I was looking at their 2007 Honda Fit with 79,000 miles, test drove it, ran great and really liked it. Kelly blue book valued this at $8,500-$9500. They wanted a ridiculous pricing of $12000 and wouldn't budge at all. Very over priced. King Honda offered a 2012 Honda fit for the exact same price. My credit is around 720 and my payments would have been $400 a month. With $3000 as a down payment, it would only go down to $301 and not including insurance. When I said I couldn't do that and Id have to look else where, they then offered a crazy warranty. Iv never heard of such a warranty, but apparently for $600 one time payment, as long as I owned the car, with $200 deductible Id have "free" maintenance. Sounds far fetched but if legit, its amazing. Over all, if you're very desperate and have awful credit and in need of a car on the spot, sure, but I think you could do better trying else where.

text: Bought a car from here, asked if there are any concerns we need to know about or anything wrong with the car. They told us nothing wrong with the car. He asked did you see the back of the car. We said yes....few minor scratches no big deal. We asked anything wrong with the car and again he said no. We asked the car looks good why are you selling so cheap. The response was because the got an over abundance of this brand of car in on the lot and they jus wanted to get them sold. Well long story short we drove it ran great seem there was no problem. Went home drove for almost an hour straight to shop had oil changed. Found out that the oil looks so bad in the car they found a oil leak. The windshield fluid container leaks ( no big deal, easy fix). Then two days later transmission went out. Now the car is on they way to a dealership to be FIXED! Famous saying buyers beware, we learned the hard way.

name: Sandar Johnson
text:
WORST CAR BUYING EXPERIENCE EVER. LONG REVIEW BUT A MUST READ REVIEW.

If i could give them 0 or even take stars i would. BEST auto sales? Ha more like worst. I bought a 2012 nissan altima from this establishment, 2 months later it blows a head gasket. IM NOT DENYING THE MOTOR RAN HOT, BUT THE TEMP GAUGE NEVER SHOWED THAT IT WAS. But why would you sell a car either knowing that it had mechanical issues, or without doing diagnostic tests (they either knew about the motor problems, or didnt care enough about their customers to see what was wrong with it when someone traded it in) After almost a week of going back and forth over whos responsible for repairs, we agreed that they would do the engine swap free of any labor charges if I paid for the motor. Once i was told repairs would begin shortly i called back frequently to get and update. Jimmy, a sales rep, told me time and time again, "it'll be ready this week." , "give it till wesnedsay", "ill call back today to give you an update" well jimmy never did, the ONLY updates i ever got were given after i called them repeatedly, or drove across town to go in the office. Well after about 3 and a half weeks being jerked around and told itll be done soon, i went to the office on a day that jimmy happened to be off. After talking to a member of management he informed me they had just started on repairs 2 days ago and it wouldnt be done for a week or so. FYI i was in the middle of a move to FL and stayed in a hotel and rented a car during this time frame which totalled around 2 grand. The car also had a good bit of my own personal property in it. So i decided to go ahead and move to FL, still waiting for my car to be repaired. After a little over a week they call and tell me the car is fixed and ready to be pucked up. So i drive the 4 hours back to auburn, had my bank refinance the car, and had a check for $9400 in my pocket ready to pay them off. When i test drove the car, i could hear a rattling sound from underneath the dash that was at its worst while idling at stops, and when i get back and ask about it they had me pop the hood while they fiddled around with the car (changing gears, accelerating, etc) and i see the motor itself moving, back and forth when he would change gears (its an auto trans but you can slide the shifter over and keep it in a certain gear). So i tell jimmy that he needs to figure out what that sound is being caused by and i want to hear from him the next day. Well good ole jimmy did what he does best and didnt call back. And after a few days of not hearing from them i figured it was time to move on. So i come by today to get all my stuff that was in the car......and its all gone, things of monitary and emotional value. Not only did they throw away all my stuff without a  call, now theyre telling me its going on paper as a repo. HAHAHAHA yeah right they can expect a call from my lawyers here soon. They are THE MOST CROOKED BUSINESS I HAVE EVER HAD THE DISPLEASURE OF DEALING WITH, IVE GOTTEN BETTER CUSTOMER SERVICE AT MCDONALD'S. AND I HAVE NEVER FELT SO CHEATED, DISRESPECTED, AND LIED TO IN MY ENTIRE LIFE. They will sell you a lemon (POS) and then screw you over when it brakes down. They take advantage of people with poor credit, give them outrageous monthly payments (was responsible for 300 a month on an altima and only 70 of that went to my principal), then repo the car as soon as they can.

SAVE YOURSELF A HEADACHE AND DRIVE RIGHT PASSED "BEST" AUTO SALES. DONT EVEN CONSIDER DOING BUSINESS WITH THEM. IF YOU READ THIS AND STILL GIVE THEM YOUR BUSINESS YOURE JUST AS STUPID AS THEY ARE.

text: I recently visited Premier Chevrolet with my daughter. We were immediately greeted by Henry Corley, who went above and beyond to be sure we found the perfect vehicle for my daughter. I cannot say enough great things about my experience with Henry at Premier. I will definitely be back to see Henry for all of my future vehicle purchases.

text: I purchased a beautiful Camaro from Grant recently. The communication and transaction was perfectly smooth. It was the easiest car purchase I have ever made and no hassle what so ever. I sent over all the financials before visiting the dealership. When I arrived the vehicle was waiting on my out front ready to test drive. We had a great conversation while I was test driving the car. I approved of the car and we quickly moved into the paper work. Their finance team was on the ball and had everything ready for me to sign and discuss. I was in and out of the dealership in an hour and a half. They have a great team there that understands what customer obsession is all about. Thank you for the great purchase and I am sure I will be referring customers in the future.

name: Jim Clark
text:
Recently, my daughter was traveling from Tuscaloosa to the Birmingham airport and had some car trouble.  She managed to make it to Premiere Chevrolet in Bessemer.  They not only scheduled the car for repairs, but got her to the airport in time to make her flight home for Christmas.  Upon returning to Birmingham, they picked her up at the airport to take her back to her repaired vehicle.  She is now safely back in Tuscaloosa to finish her Senior year.  So appreciative of their efforts, and the fact that we were still able to enjoy Christmas with her.

They also did a fantastic job of explaining and fixing the problem with her car.  I just can’t imagine receiving this kind of service anywhere else.  Great service, with above and beyond southern hospitality.  You can’t go wrong with this dealership.

Our Sales Consultant, Michael Williams, was friendly and professional and went above and beyond for us. While we bought the truck last night, we left it overnight for washing and detailing and he met us on his off day tonight for us to pick up our new (to us) truck and on top of that filled the tank for us!
Everyone we encountered made us feel welcome and valued as customers
This was the easiest and least time consuming car purchase I’ve ever made.
I highly recommend the team at Premiere for your next car or truck purchase

text: The dealership had the vehicle I posted for one price and then sold it for another price. Then when I looked online I realized that the dealership is known for doing such. So much so that they have reviews stating that and they even put it in a description for the vehicle which I didn’t see prior to. I think it is very unfair to post a car for one price to get the customers up there and then once the customer is there the price is 4-5 thousand dollars more than what you expect to pay. That is pretty much false advertisement and then they don’t want to give you the vehicle for the price that they have it listed for. I think that is ridiculous and pretty annoying.

text:
Henry Corley worked with me until I found the right used SUV. He was courteous and demonstrated a willingness to understand my needs.  Ask for Henry if you want a good deal on a new or used vehicle.  He listens; he's empathetic and will stay with you until you are in the right auto.

My only complaint is about the dealer's detail department.  My purchase was not clean on the inside.  However, with a little scrubbing, I was able to remove the stains from seats, carpet, and dash areas.

Thanks to Henry, I have the vehicle that I wanted.

resp.text: Thank you Thomas for taking time to share your experience here at Premiere Chevrolet. I'm sorry that the vehicle you selected was not satisfactory upon delivery. I will make sure to address this  issue with my detail department. Your feedback means a lot to us and it helps to improve our process. Henry is definitely a hard compassionate worker along with the rest of our staff. Thank you again for choosing Premiere Chevrolet for your automotive needs!

name: Rhegan Snipes
text: Brought my husbands truck in to have this weird noise checked out. He had an appointment at 8 am, he asked for an update around 10 and they said they were about to start looking at it. 2:00 rolled around and he asked for another update and they told him the men were on lunch and that they hadn’t looked at it yet but were planning to after lunch. 6 hours and not a single person even LOOKED at his truck to see if they could determine what was wrong — so he left. My husband only has one off day every now and then and he spent his entire day at premiere and came home with absolutely no answers. We’re very disappointed  in the service department. What’s the point of appointments if it’s still going to take > 6 hours to even get an opinion.

resp.text: I want to apologize for any inconvenience Mrs. Snipes. I have notified upper management and we are making sure that this never happens again to any customer.  Your feedback means a lot to us and we are truly sorry.

name: VaQuita M. Curry
text: The dealership did not have the color suv that I wanted, but they did find one for me at another dealer. They went to pick it up as well, which was great.  There are a couple things that were overlooked as one of the tires was out of balance pretty badly and the detail job left swirl marks when they washed it (it's a black vehicle, so you can notice everything on them). I had to take it somewhere else to find and correct the tire issue as the dealership informed me that new tires ride a certain way the first 500-750 miles.  I've purchased a number of brand new vehicles, and never encountered a vehicle shaking/vibrating like that.  After I requested that they check again (leaving it with them), I was informed that the tires had too much air. After the issue still existed, I took it elsewhere and it drove so smoothly once the out of balance tire was fixed.  They stated that they would reimburse me. The people are nice at the dealership, but taking a little more time to ensure things are done and checked correctly would have made the overall experience a lot better.

name: JOHN AKERS
text: Noticed a vibration in frontend of my 2017. Daniel signed me in and said he would let me know what the problem was. In a short time he told me that the transmission fluid needed to be changed and that it would take about 2 hours. I told him to go ahead. In about 2 hours he came and told me I was ready to go.

resp.text: Thank you John for taking time to share your experience here at Premiere Chevrolet. Daniel prides himself with delivery excellent service and will certainly keep you in the loop during your entire service visit. We believe in building lasting relationships and value you as a customer!

name: I Am Nerd
text:
I would not recommend buying from this dealership or getting your vehicle fixed from here. The salesman when I was purchasing, knew the budget I wanted to stick too. He quoted us $50 above our monthly amount. We agreed to it. The next day when seeing the financial department, they tell me my monthly price was $75 more than the salesman's quote. So an extra $125 than I was told. Very deceptive but I wanted that vehicle. So I got it. Then the salesman tells me "Hey, we got it pretty close." No not close at all.

Then was told at 7000 miles I would get a complimentary oil change, rotation and balance by the same salesman. Well guess what? Not so, they said I would have to pay for the balance.

Before my free oil change, I ran over a small screw and my back left tire was loosing some PSI. Called the dealership and they told me I would have to pay $250 + for a new tire and work. They said they couldn't patch it. So I called 2 other professional tire shops and they laughed when I told them what the dealership told me. I got it fixed for $8 and took less than 10 min. And it's like brand new. No issues.

If you want to be treated right and not be deceived and lied too, please,  don't come here. Do yourself a favor and find another Chevy dealership.

resp.text: Hi Jacob, we appreciate you taking the time to give us more details about your experience. We value our customer's feedback as we are always looking for ways to improve. Do you mind giving our GM, Robert Pollard a call when you can? (205)424-4121, thank you.

name: Arthur M
text: I dropped my vehicle off Monday morning. I'm told by Daniel that they would look at it THAT DAY. Although he told a guy in line in front of me that it would be Wednesday before he could get an diagnostic. I call Daniel back later that evening for him to tell me that it would be the next morning (Tuesday) before they could look at it. I call Daniel again at 12pm Tuesday and he said that they looked at it off and a couple times but they really haven't looked at it thoroughly and that it would be later that day. I called around 3pm and he said that he would let me know something before they left that day. No call. I call again on Wednesday @at 12 pm and I'm left on hold for a few minutes and the secretary comes back to take a message. He supposedly was  busy with another customer. I don't get a call. Again, I call back around 430pm and he tells me that the mechanic had to hold my battery cable to start the vehicle. And it would be $650  to change my battery cables. SIX HUNDRED AND FIFTY DOLLARS!!  I show up Thursday morning to pick my vehicle up and it won't start. Mind you, I started the vehicle everyday for two weeks since having the initial problem. Daniel laughs in my face  when I expressed that to him. After I left I tighten the battery cable(30 second process)and the truck starts just fine. I took that as we don't want to fix your vehicle if you expect us to do what we say.  Wish I could give them a zero.

resp.text: Thank you, for your business and thank you for your feedback. Our goal is to make every experience a pleasant and memorable one, but we apologize for your inconvenience while visiting our store. Please call our service manager, Barry Sparkman (205)424-4121.

text: First off I did not have my car service on 10-06-2020. Second when i bought my car on a Thursday I drove it home and by Monday my check engine light came on. When I took it back to the service department the man said something was weak under the hood I forgot what it was, but I had to take my car back about 4 times already and still waiting for a part to come in. I haven't got that phone call yet, before I even sign papers for the car I asked the man that took my money for the down payment. I ask him whats the carfax he politely told me not anything wrong with it and that his dad had it and he did not drive it much because, he had other cars he drove also, and the check engine light is still on and they don't know whats wrong with the car. If I knew this I wouldn't bought the car. I wouldn't recommend anyone to get a car from their at all. they just want your money and that's how I see it. Poor service, poor service department, poor customer service. I was about to send my brother there to get him a car until this happen to me.

name: Mark Gwynn
text:
I had previous recalls with my company leased truck before and I had taken it to H????? Chevrolet. Short story - it was extremely frustrating working with H?????: it took several days beyond the promised timeframe and the communications were non-existent. I was very angry with how I was treated - even their service manager's apology was poor.

So with these new recalls, I decided to bring the truck to Premiere Chevrolet. My first contact on the phone was terrific and responsive, the service team was ready to go when I arrived, and  the work was done in less than an hour (the original promise from my first phone call was 1.5 hours). The waiting area was clean, pleasant, and safe. I could tell that Premiere Chevrolet was not just a different level of Chevrolet dealership, but a different level of auto dealership and business all together. Everyone respected the current COVID 19 restrictions and protections, so as an "at risk" person, I really appreciated that as well. Everyone was super and Daniel Slaten was extremely professional. I appreciate Premiere Chevrolet's dedication to customer service - it was very apparent!

resp.text: Good work ethic, and attention to detail which is why you’ll always get top notch customer service from Premiere Chevrolet. We are overjoyed that we were able to provide this to you, Mark. Thank you again for your kind words!

name: Kristie Williams
text:
I have a close friend that recently bought a car from this dealership. From the moment she drove off the lot, she begun experiencing problems with her mini copper. She posted her experience, however, it was deleted from the reviews. Here is what she said

"As a spouse of an armed service veteran, I recently purchase a 2012 Mini Cooper countryman from premiere Chevrolet. The day of the purchase one of the warning lights was on, the dealer ship couldnâ  t figure out why it was on and how to get rid of it, That was my first incident  with the car, but since I drove over an hour away to pick the car up I trusted the dealership in that the car was good and they said that it was just a sensor. Two days later the check engine light came on , still thinking that it was the sensors, I over look at the magnitude of the situation. Exactly 4 weeks after having the car, it started smoking so I had to get it towed to Mini Cooper. Mini informed me that I have an oil leak, my turbo went out, and other things. My grand total for repairs come to 13,000 dollars. I think that it was very unprofessional and dishonest that You sold me a car that needed so much work done to it. I would not recommend buying a used car from this business."

name: Emily G
text:
What an absolutely wonderful experience. We drove in from north of Nashville, about 4 and a half hours. I had the pleasure of working with Grant over the phone, then Michael when we arrived. The vehicle we purchased was EXACTLY as described over the phone by Grant, he even sent me pictures via text. He was upfront, honest, and just so kind. When we arrived, the vehicle we came to see was parked in the front and ready for us to look over and test drive. Michael answered all of our questions and was very helpful. When it was time to complete our sale, Grant already had all of our paperwork done ahead of time, it took about 30 minutesto sign a few things  then walk out the door with our new vehicle.

We had been looking for a month for a replacement vehicle for me after mine was totaled. I spoke with numerous dealerships within a 150 mike radius of Nashville. There were several times that we drove over an hour out of our way to see one, only to arrive to find the vehicle was NOT at all as described, it was beyond infuriating. Premier Chevrolet was 100% up front and honest from the first phone call. We will absolutely do business with them again, and also recommend them to our friends and family should they be looking for a vehicle.

Thank you so very much to Grant and Michael for going above and beyond what I even expected from a car dealership. It was so great to meet you both, and we really appreciate you and your hard work.

resp.text: We strive to be the best for you and your car Emily. Thank you for taking the time to acknowledge us, we hope to meet all your needs in the future!  Again, Congratulations on your purchase!

name: Dannielle Myrick
text: I bought a vehicle from Premiere Chevrolet in January of 2019. Hoping that I would not have to have problems with a vehicle for some time. I went to the dealership because I was told they were representable. They sold me a vehicle that has major electrical problems. So now it is July of 2019 and I have a vehicle that has been sitting up for 2 months and cost more to fix than the car is worth. I have already put about $1,000 worth of repairs into the car. And now it's going to cost me quite a bit more to get it running.

Our goal is to make every experience a pleasant and memorable one, but we apologize for the inconvenience you have experienced with your car. name: Ashley M Richards
text: Premiere Chevrolet has always been good to me. I am a very loyal customer and I always recommend them to anyone until what happened last Thursday. My wallet was stolen and I had money in it. I talked to the owner to see if I could get reimbursed some of the money back and all he said was be is not responsible and just apologized a couple of times. It's the fact that I didn't receive the money back it's the fact that he didn't offer me anything at all. No type of help discounts nothing. I don't want to receive a car from a company that doesn't help you when you really need it. The owner could have helped me he just didn't want to and my wallet was the only one that was stolen. I'm not saying don't go to them for that specific reason but I am saying loyalty or making sure the customer is satisfied doesn't matter to them as much as you think. It's OK though because soon I will doing business with someone else and giving them my car back. He didn't offer me anything to trade in my car so for two days I walked out with nothing. I will receive my belongings back but I won't forget this.

name: toby jolly
text:
Here is how premier chevrolet works:

I just tried to buy the truck in the picture. It is clearly advertised on their website for $43k. I was going to trade my loaded f150 fx4 which is very nice. They offered $17k for my truck. I keep up with truck values pretty close so I know my truck will retail in the $23k range. Whatever, I was expecting a $19-20k trade offer but $17k was close enough to start dealing. EXCEPT... They had their truck at $53k on the paperwork, $10k over advertised price. I also have been looking at these trail boss chevrolets and I know they sell everywhere for under $45k. So, long story short they were trying to get my truck for $7k.

I was in the car business for a lot of years. There are good dealerships out there that treat their customers fair with no bs. Premier is not one of those dealerships. Do business with them at your own risk.

name: Mark Bria
text:
I had to have my AC Condenser replaced after only 57k miles. Apparently this is a widely known problem with GM vehicles and a $1000+ repair cost to the owner that should be covered under a recall or part warranty because of the shear number of failures. Just look it up it is not hard to find. If it were a safety issue it would already be covered.

I will say that the service writer did everything that he could to get my vehicle back to me the same day and was apologetic of the fact that the local dealership has seen a huge number of these repairs. He even went as far as check to see if my 2016 Yukon may be covered with some discount related to the same failure but it appears that GM thinks that it is OK for a part to fail at 60k miles but not at 61k miles.

Dealers should be doing more to convince corporate GM to protect their potential customer base. Someone paying as much as I have for 2 GM vehicles should not be hit with the repair cost for a well documented part failure that continued to be used even AFTER it was identified. GM needs to do the right thing if they want to have my continued business.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback and thank you for your business. We appreciate your business and we are looking forward to GM to properly address your concerns.

They stated that they did and put the sticker up in the window . Two weeks later our truck did not have any oil or fluids in the car . So they tell me they do not put fluids in the car but windshield wiper fluid so I stated to them it is no windshield wiper fluid nor oil in my truck. What a sneaky place I would never go back again.

name: Katie L
text: Charged $96 for an oil change on a 2014 Silverado, we have 23 fleet vehicles and have never paid that much for an oil change. We have a bunch of vehicles in the area for the Amazon project and will not be taking them here. Average is $65 for most of our trucks that get regular oil changes across the US.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave Premiere Chevrolet a review. We make every attempt to be competitive within the marketplace. Our recommended oil change consists of fully synthetic oil, the required filter and an engine oil treatment. The fully synthetic oil reduces the number of number oil change visits allowing you to drive up to 7,500 miles between oil changes. The oil treatment includes an oil additive that helps clean sludge buildup and deposits, helps prevent oil breakdown, reduces engine wear, increases fuel economy and extends your warranty coverage when serviced at the proper intervals. However, we do offer a non-synthetic conventional oil service for under the national average for $59. We appreciate your business and we will continue to strive to provide you with the best customer service. I would like to talk to you personally to address your concern. Please call Bill Whitehead, partner/owner at 205.424.4121.

Service with a smile. 🤗

name: Wayne Ivey
text: Received a great deal on our 2020 Ford EcoSport.  We were able to do everything online!  Appreciate help from Shelby Parker, Dohnovan Wilcox and Edward Pyle for all the help in making our experience great.  Highly recommend this dealership!

name: Brenda Evans
text: I always come to Stivers Ford downtown to have my car serviced. The service is quick, and my service manager, Tim, is always pleasant. He is very professional, knowledgeable, and goes out of his way to make sure my vehicle needs are met. I highly recommend Tim and Stivers Ford downtown for any vehicle.

name: Hannah Todd
text: Jessica was great in making sure I knew what was going on with my car and well taken care of. I received service over two days and both days I was treated exceptionally well by all the staff and everyone was super helpful. By the second day some of the staff even remembered me/my name and made it a point to talk to me. I really appreciated the determination of the service team to find out what was wrong with my car and fix it accordingly. I'm from out of state so it was so wonderful to feel at ease with getting my car fixed. I wish I was from the area so I could go here regularly!

name: Joshua Pleasants
text: After going to many dealerships and being humiliated, I found myself here. I worked with Karley and she was literally the NICEST person I have ever met. She didn't haggle me. She didn't force me to do anything. And best of all, I felt as if I was part of the Adamson family. Everyone here was very nice and made me feel at home. From beginning to end, I was satisfied with the customer service. They were willing to go out of their way to ensure that I got what was best for me. If you're looking for any car, come here and talk to them and they will treat you as part of the family!

name: Brian Brocato
text: Quick service. Jessica kept me informed throughout the repairs. I will go there in the future if needed.

name: Lady S.
text: Mark was awesome, he made me feel like I was his top priority! And I really appreciate that! And all of the other staff members I encountered were very nice and sweet as well. I would bring my car back for future services. Thanks guys!

name: James Younger
text: Stivers Ford of Birmingham had the exact vehicle I was looking for, I had been looking for about a week for me a GT Mustang. Eugene Jones was the Salesman that helped us out with locating, prepping and fueling our ride up. He was more than helpful, he made us feel like family. Then we moved on to the financing department where Shelby Parker took care of our loan for the vehicle. He went out of his way to find us the lowest apr, and set us up with a service plan to cover everything for the next six years. I would highly recommend this dealership to anyone looking for a new vehicle, I drove five hours to get mine and would do it again.

name: Lance Huffstutler
text:
This place is unlike many dealerships in the area. The sales manager and sales people are genuinely great. Avery Blackall, in particular, was a great guy to work with when trying to find a new car. He found a car that met my price point, however, I wanted something similar to what I was currently driving and not go down in the value I perceived. He was part counselor, stress reliever and provided a very optimistic view to car buying. The manager was extremely fair in my trade in, something I haven’t been able to find with other dealerships. Usually dealerships ding you for everyone imperfection, but they gave me a fair trade in value and even helped by a few thousand to try to get this sale done.

I got a call a few days later, and Avery got me back in. It still was not my price point but met a lot of my needs in a vehicle. They also gave me an extremely generous offer on my trade in and got me an excellent deal. Overall, I think out of the four cars I’ve purchased, this has got to take the best experience I’ve had. I think the sales guy and the manager made this the best experience.

name: Erick
text: Ed at Stivers Ford made my experience delightful. He was helpful, knowledgeable, professional and knowledgeable. I will most definitely bring my car back. Thanks Ed!

name: Carol Lowry
text: My brother and I had a very pleasant experience purchasing a car at Stivers Ford, Birmingham yesterday.  Cody Banks was very helpful and a pleasure to do business with.  We feel like we were treated with respect and we were able to purchase a car that will suit my brother's needs.  Overall it was an enjoyable experience and everyone was very helpful and nice.

name: Shanita White
text: My experience at Stivers Ford was great! Everyone in the service department was very helpful especially Jessica at the front desk. She made sure I was updated on any problems with my car from the time I dropped off my car until the services was completed. I will definitely come back in the future.

name: Braden Smith
text: I worked with Ashley Andrews when picking out my most recent vehicle. Ashley was very friendly, courteous, and attentive. Would consider buying with Stivers Ford in the future. The price I paid was competitive to other dealerships in the area.

name: Greg Gibbons
text: Had a mechanical malfunction on my F-150 while on a trip.  Service I received at Stivers Ford, particularly from service advisor (Mark), was outstanding.  Got me in promptly, diagnosed and repaired the problem, and back on the road in about 4 hours.  Truck running fine since so diagnosis/repair seems accurate.  My thanks to everyone.

name: Tony Rucker
text: Got a great deal from Sparky on April 2, 2021 on a 2020 Ford Fusion Titanium. Very pleased with the helpful and cordial staff. Kudos to Sparky Sparks,  Shelby Parker and the Gen. Sales Mgr., Edward Pyle. We hope to do business again!

name: Chris Parker
text: We used Stivers Birmingham location and had Darrius Conner as our salesman. And after going to 2 other dealerships, Darius was able to get me in my new Bronco! Couldn’t have had a better experience and will definitely be using them for any car needs in the future.

name: H Stallworth
text: The service was great. Jessica the person at the service desk was great.She was very helpful and knew lots about my car maintenance. The only thing the price was much more than I expected. I have been going there for years when it was Adamson Ford.  I will definitely continue to go for all my service needs.

name: Angie
text: The service at Stiver’s Ford was amazing and efficient. I had my car fixed and repaired in a short amount of time. Mark, my service advisor, kept me informed almost daily with information about my car and the repairs. They did a really great job and it was reasonably priced for what I had to have fixed. I will definitely go back in the future for my car maintenance and any repairs.

name: Shavonne Askew
text: Mr. Eugene Jones was so wonderful to work with. He was really thorough with my vehicle of interest and I left with my desired choice. Thank you!

name: Lawrence McKiernan
text: Tim and his team were great in the service department.  They diagnosed the rotors and replaced them for a very fair price.  We love Stivers Ford!

name: Andy Rocks
text:
Mr. Mark was helpful, knowledgeable and prompt in getting my oil service done in time. I liked the part where another advisor tested the car’s battery right in front of me and even provided a printed report copy informing me that it was part of their precheck and from
that report I shouldn’t be having any issues anytime soon. Awesome folks out there.

name: lakeguygb
text: Purchased vehicle online - Communications was good throughout. Saved me a 7 hour round trip. Did paperwork at home when they delivered and they took the trade in with them. A follow up a few weeks after the sale would have been a bonus. Delivery driver was also very polite !

name: Russell Pruitt
text: I was helped immensely by service advisor Tim, who made certain I understood what was happening and would be happening with my vehicle.  Most importantly he returns my phone calls with the information I have requested.  Thanks Tim

name: Jack Womack
text: My 2017 Ford Expedition had some service needs so I took it to Stivers Ford because it was close to my place of employment.  Even though I didn't purchase the vehicle from them, Gerald in the service department was quick to attend to my needs and also took care of some other items that I was not even aware of.  Because parts had to be ordered and my vehicle had to spend a few nights with them, Gerald offered me a brand new Explorer to test drive so I had a means of transportation.  As a result of this excellent customer service, my next Ford will be purchased from Stivers.

name: spencer fortney
text: Ed in the service department was great! He explained and kept me informed on everything that was going on. Overall was highly satisfied with both the customer service and the work that was done on my truck. Will be using them in the future.

name: Bill Cain
text: Shelby Parker was amazing to work with. First visit and had Points from my initial purchase of my new Ranger. Had no idea how to use them. Shelby Was able to to explain and direct me on how to use points so I could add a tool box to my truck. Very friendly as all the folks there were. Called me next day to let me know my toolbox had already come in. Shelby was a pleasure to work with and I’ll definitely be back for all service needs.

name: R.M. McRae
text: Shelby Parker with Stiver’s Ford in Birmingham was excellent in her service as was all of the service personnel. Shelby processed both my F250 diesel and my wife’s Ford Edge simultaneously and our wait time was minimal. A great department in downtown Birmingham to have your vehicles serviced. Five stars for Shelby and her co-workers at Stivers!

name: Allison Cervantes
text:
UPDATE: Now I CAN say something about the dealership...They say they'll contact you, but they never will. They really don't care.

Can’t really say anything about the dealership itself but a huge word of caution to avoid Sparky Sparks. He’ll promise things he can’t actually do and waste your time.
Called at 8:45am saying I was interested in purchasing a vehicle that same day and he was aware I was coming from Metro Atlanta. Thought he was being super helpful because he even texted me through personal phone. I called him not even an hour later to double check if the vehicle was actually available and about different payment options so that I would come prepared. He answered that he’d keep the keys in his pocket and made sure the vehicle was put aside not to be sold. Kept in touch the rest of the day and he asked me for my eta, let him know I was an hour away and he responded with “cool!”. I arrive to the dealership and walk in to speak to him and he is still being kind and telling me he was going to finish up with other customers and to wait outside. When he finally gets to me he has the audacity to tell me if there’s another vehicle I’d like to purchase saying he can give me the biggest discount of my life because he just sold the one I was interested in 30 minutes ago. Please ask for a different salesman that won’t lie to you!!!

resp.text: GSM Ed Pyle will reach out to you to discuss your visit and concerns.

name: Dennis Krantz
text: Having a firm reservation to get my vehicle serviced saves me time. I especially like it when I get there and Mark, my service writer knows my name. He and others on the staff recognize me as a loyal customer. While my vehicle is serviced, I sit in Stivers' clean waiting room and read a book. Stivers personnel always greet us as they  walk through the room. Finally, checkout is fast and easy and my vehicle is waiting for me. I love my Ford Escape Titanium and the service at Stivers Ford.

name: T B
text: Just picked up my new F150 full hybrid 4x4.  The staff of Shelby, Cody and David were awesome.  Very honest and professional.

name: Colton Spain
text: Amazing experience at Stivers! They had me in n out with a truck I’ve always wanted. Avery Blackall did an outstanding job and I’ll definitely recommend this dealership to my friends 🤘🏼

name: Alex Gibson
text:
My first Google review. Wish I could give them 5 stars because that would mean I had a great experience. But buyers BEWARE of the management here. If you buy a used car or happen to get a lemon, you may be in for a huge headache. I bought a used vehicle on Friday, 2/19, and on Monday 2/22 I already had it being looked at by my mechanic. This was AFTER I tried to get management to respond. Vehicle's fuel pump wasn't working, and Stivers said DO NOT tow it to our place because we don't work on Rams. My mechanic found out that the fuse box had been heavily rigged to send extra juice to a failing fuel pump, just enough to get it to run. He said that this was easy to spot once they looked at it, meaning that Stivers doesn't check out the vehicles well enough. I have tried, repeatedly, to get them to return my call and talk to me about the issue, hoping they will at least acknowledge it. And additional $2000 later I've got the van back, but NO thanks to Stivers. My mechanic, on the other hand, is going to get the SECOND Google review I've ever written, and it will be 5 stars.

As of the date of this review, we are just a month past the date I bought the van, and I still have not heard from them. This was after my salesperson and the manager BOTH said he would get back in touch with me. They have three different phone numbers, and not a single message or call has been made. I will keep trying, and I hope that someone in their marketing group will see this and get back with me. I'm hoping there has been some minor miscommunication there and that I will get some assistance and help covering the expenses soon. If that happens, I'll be happy to re-evaluate my rating.

name: Macy Jones
text: Very friendly and quick service! Everyone I spoke with was exceptionally nice and very helpful! It was my first visit but not my last!

name: Gary Curl
text: Had a very good experience at Stivers Ford for a service visit. This was my first visit since buying a new Ford Fusion there. I went to get an oil change, but found out I could get what they call "The Works" for a full checkup of my car. The service advisor, Edward Jeszka, was very friendly and helpful in explaining what all they would do. I had made an appointment online on their site which was very easy and convenient. I got there at my appointment time and Edward greeted me, and they went right to work on my car. Even with all they did I was only there a bit over an hour. Very satisfied and looking forward to letting them do my service. Another perk is that I had earned points for buying a new car there so all this was done with points and cost me nothing.  Check them out (formerly Adamson Ford) if you are in the market for a car.

name: Frels on Rock
text: This was a truly 5-Star, first-class experience for us with Stivers Ford, and specifically Demetrius Denson, who was phenomenal!  We had a virtual urgent vehicle situation where we had to buy a car ASAP, and Demetrius delivered in every facet, from the moment he politely answered my phone call, all the way through to driving off the lot 24 hours later.  Top-notch customer service all the way!

name: Jared Danks
text: Had a great experience,  part took longer than expected but Tim and the team helped me with transportation and kept me updated on the progress. Overall friendly and courteous staff.

name: Jennifer Gowers
text: I had a wonderful experience with Stivers Ford! From Shelby Parker's responses from my first inquiry, to Aaron Cummings follow up & seamless sale to Asher's financial paperwork completion. I will recommending Stiver to all of my friends and family and am thrilled to be once again in the Ford family.  My father owned a dealership for over 30 years and I'm not easy to please! This is a GREAT review I promise!

text: Jessica was so helpful to me. Service fast and everything explained well. ☺️

text: I would never use their service department ever, I wanted to give them zero stars. I carried my car to them in January 2021 and they charged me over $550.00 to not fix my car, what they said was the problem did not fix the problem at all and at the same time I was having trouble with my wind shield wipers and they said it would cost over $700.00 to fix, I then went to another Ford dealership and they fixed it while saving me $500.00 to boot. Will NEVER go to them again!

name: Nicole Heck
text: I received excellent service from Anthony, Eddie, Timothy, and Shelby!  Everyone was very easy to work with and made our buying process enjoyable.

name: Michael Andrews
text: It was a great experience service was great employees were considerate and polite and respectful will b having all future service done here two stand out employees were so awesome and helping me Jessica and Mark they really put customers first which is a great thing. So anybody needing service done to your car weather its major or just a oil change i recommend Stivers Ford of Birmingham A1 service

name: Rick Elliott
text: Overall experience was good but Avery was awesome and did a great job.  The finance manager, Asher and Avery stayed very late until the deal was done.   Very happy

name: Emily Lackey
text: I would definitely rate it a 5! Everyone was so nice and they helped me get exactly what I wanted and in the price range I needed. They also stayed over later to finish up my sale. It was amazing customer service and atmosphere in general. Thank you all so much. Especially a thank you Avary Blackall, David Agee, and Shelby Parker. The customer service went above and beyond.

name: James Thomas
text: Great Service Department experience. Will definitely visit again. Mr. Parker made the whole thing a breeze.

name: Michael Price
text: THE worst place! When it was Adamson Ford it was great! My 2018 car was here for 3 weeks for O2 sensors and was never fixed! I got so fed up with HAVING TO CALL THEM for updates only to be told I’d get a callback THAT NEVER CAME!!! Coworker placed his car at another Ford for a new transmission 2 days after I left mine at Stivers and he got his back in 4 days! Took mine to Ernest McCarty and got it back the same day!!!! Was also promised a loaner vehicle and never got it!!! If you want your time wasted and your car not to be fixed, go to this place!

name: Matt Joiner

text: The entire team at Strivers Ford in Birmingham was a pleasure to deal with. I had Seth Kelosky as a sales rep and he was awesome! He knows the vehicles inside and out and was very easy to work with. Great service all around.

name: Joseph Fields-Weldon
text: Saw a FB post about a special event. I called the dealership and spoke with the internet sales manager, Seth. I told him my credit score, the vehicle I had for trade and the payoff amount, and what I was looking to do. He told me that given the details, there would be no reason they couldn’t get me in another vehicle. I left work 30 minutes early to get their and it was the BIGGEST WASTE OF TIME. Sales people Eddie and CJ got the details that Seth already had and it took them five minutes to come out to the lot that had very little inventory to let me know that they couldn’t help me. What’s interesting about this is that I tried to do business with them late last year and had a totally different set of circumstances at that point. I was told that I would have to do the same thing they told me last year when I was in a different set of circumstances. Just go to another dealership. If they don’t want to deal with you then they hand you the same lines.

text: Worst experience trying to buy car I've ever had in the over 50 years and over 40 cars/ suv/trucks of buying and paying cash for. They told me that if I payed cash the price was over $2500.00 more than the price listed on thier internet site if I wasn't traded in a car and financing it with them. Sounds to us like their making money on trading in your car and their financing schemes and the cars they sale. Please beware of any listed price shown and anything they say because they have so many excuses and lots of bull. This is the first time I've tried to buy something and so many reasons why the price was more than advertised. Please find a honest and reliable dealer before letting some car shark take your hard earned money.

12/17/2020 update - - payoff has been made and I've received reimbursement for the additional payment.

resp.text: Mr Hannum, the we apologize for this situation. I have the tracking numbers for both the pay off and reimbursement fir your automated payment. I left a voicemail not to long ago, please call me back at your earliest convenience or email me at lpearsall@stiversonline.com. Please accept our sincere apologies sir.

Friendly, dependable.

name: James Nelson
text: I had the worst experience I have ever had trying to buy a vehicle here.  I drove 2 hours to the dealership to look at a used van.  When I arrived I noticed that the van had a rear liftgate which prohibits the installation of the ladder rack I was going to add to it.  I told them it wouldn’t work for me, then inquired about a new van.  We couldn’t find it so my salesperson said let me check on this.  A few minutes later he came back and said it was at a lot a few blocks away.  He asked me to wait amd said he would go get it. I agreed.  Thirty minutes later I was still waiting.  I called my salesperson to see what was going on and got no answer. I finally left to start the 2 hour drive back home.  I texted him and told him I was leaving.  He said he found the van and would send pictures.  Frustrated at this point, I thought I can see pictures online but whatever.  This was on a Monday.  Finally, on Saturday I agreed to the terms of purchase.  They asked when I could come down and sign the papers and I asked them to email them and I would sign them electronically.  The manager didn’t know if they were setup to do that yet but would check and let me know.  (Another reviewer on here said they did their hole deal online!) I didn’t hear back from him so I reached out on Monday and asked for a proposal with the final terms.  I got that email and did not hear back from them again. I reached out to them on Friday and was told they were trying to figure out how to get me the paper work.  I didn’t hear back so Saturday evening I told the manager that I wasn’t going to purchase the van.  So far, I haven’t gotten a reply.  We had a deal, the financing was approved and yet it seems they were not interested in finishing the deal.  I have never experienced such at any other dealership.  I spent three years in automotive sales, when someone said we’ve got a deal we were always quick to get them signed sealed and delivered.  I’m still stunned by this outcome.  I would recommend you go to Long Lewis where you will find a much more pleasant car buying experience.

name: PABLO TREVINO
text: Great Experience working with Shelby Parker

name: Danielle Crownover
text: This dealership is definitely good, has great people but management wise no. So for as Ed (The sales Manager, Lydia (training coordinator I’m guessing) And Daniel Flatt (General sales manger) so I was offered a position for Stivers Ford of Birmingham and started training, you have to do hours of fmc dealer/starts training to be certified to sale cars. So not only did I spend a lot of time doing these test I only had 4 left to do when I came in today. So I was stopped by Ed and Lydia and they proceed to tell me I’m fired.. I’m very confused as to why cause I was not given a proper reason! So all day today I’ve been trying to get in touch with the general manager to ask why I have been fired, because Daniel was texting me asking me about the test, and how everything was going. Apparently Ford isn’t the right fit for me and I’m not a good candidate according to Lydia. I have 7 years of customer service and the job offers training so I’m not sure how that made sense. In my attempt to contact the General sales manager aka Daniel Flatt he has ignored me and now blocked my number. So I’m hoping this gets the dealerships attention. I was really counting on this job to help me pay my bills that are late (due to covid haven’t been able to find work) not only would it have helped paid my bills. This Ford Dealership has very poor management skills and I want to know why Daniel Didn’t come and talk to me or anything and why I spend countless hours and days working on test just to be fired.

This is the 4th Ford F150 I have bought from Sparky Sparks, and Adamson Ford. In a world of BS car brokers and sales people, it is refreshing to deal with Sparky and Adamson. Honest. Easy. Good people. I do not haggle. What is best price and best deal? sparky delivers. No BS. That is why he is one of the most prolific Ford sales people in the country. A pro.

I have bought over 20 cars in my lifetime. Nobody I recommend to call other than Sparky and Adamson for a Ford. And I love my new F150. I take it off road and hunt. I work in the woods. And when I need to wash it and take it to town, it is a great and comfortable ride. Merry Christmas.! 🎄🎄

name: Misty Johnson
text: I searched for a vehicle online.  I found an older vehicle with over 100K for what I felt I could get for a reasonable payment.  During the finance process, they found out that my monthly payments were going to be a little higher than what I felt like I could afford.  The salesmen, Mr. Sparky Sparks and Mr. Bob Willard found out that for $15 cheaper per month I could purchase a brand new 2017 Ford Fiesta.  I was in dire straights for a vehicle as my other one was just totaled.  They were so compassionate towards my needs and felt like they honestly cared about my situation.  I cried in both happiness and relief.  Adamson Ford has a great sales team and I would recommend a purchase from there to all of my friends and family.

text: I drove all the way from Atlanta GA to get a vehicle. I already had check in hand and insurance card ready. I drove 2 hours to get to this dealership and only one finance manager available. I waited over 2.5 hours just to sign my financial agreement. Poor management and no consideration of my time and drive home. Horrible customer service and on top of that I rented a one way vehicle and had no ride back because I was hoping to take my vehicle I wanted to purchase home. I don’t appreciate this dealership nor how I was treated. Please do better when someone is ready to buy your vehicles. Shouldn’t have to wait, you guys should’ve been waiting on me.

resp.text: We strive to give our best customer experience to all If our customers. We apologize for your experience and will use all the information you have provided to ensure this doesn’t happen again. We appreciate your business and respect your time.

name: Key Key
text: I decided to try this place due to it being so close to me. They changed the oil as I requested but this is my first time being charge for tire rotations and I've been to a lot of different Ford dealerships in different states due to traveling with my job. Then for the multi point inspection...I know they just press buttons. Boxes were not marked correctly. I have existing codes that have not been squared away and they marked it in good condition. If you know your car and just need a quick oil change this is a decent place...customer service was good and they completed the oil change, but if you don't know your car and need recommendations on what's really going on with your car...dont bother with this place. By the way...I am in the military and work on mechanics all day everyday so this review is legit!

resp.text: Would you mind sending me your name so I can look into your MPI during your visit. We normally do not pull codes during a works service unless the customer requests because we would have to dispatch into our main shop. Please let me know if I can help in any other way. name: Brittany Alexander
text:
We had a wonderful, stress free experience at Adamson Ford.  I highly recommend you visit there as well.  We saved thousands of dollars when compared to the other local dealership that uses a “no haggle” best price advertising campaign.

Our salesman, Justin Gray, was not only extremely knowledgeable about the details of the vehicle we were looking for and the various the trim packages, but also he essentially had the dealerships’ inventory committed to memory, so he was able to find us just what we needed in no time at all.

Justin didn’t employ any over the top sales tactics, and we never had to haggle.  Instead, he worked with us to find the right vehicle for us and went above and beyond to get us the best price possible (in reality,  not just in an advertisement). Justin was able to deliver on every request / concession we made.

The sales manager, David Galbraith,  was very polite and went out of his way to meet us.  He also went out of his way to get us more money for our trade-in. Refinancing folks and paperwork process was mind bogglingly fast.

You should definitely stop by and don’t be tricked by the claims of “no-haggle,” “best price” on the sticker type dealerships.

Each wheel had drastically different air pressure even though matched them all to the factory recommend psi before bringing it in. One was around 12psi over the recommended setting. They do offer a shuttle to work which was convenient but overall the service experience was average and slightly frustrating.

text: Phil Powell exceeded our car buying experience. He first listened to my needs and wants. This allowed him to know which direction and approach he needed totake. No one likes spending hours in a dealership and he respected my time by doing all the necessary work prior to me getting there. He was extremely patient with me as I decided on the “perfect” truck for me. After he showed me a few vehicles, I still wasn’t satisfied and I apologized. He assured me that his goal was to make me happy with my purchase. He was true to his word. They didn’t have the vehicle I wanted on their lot but he found one and they went and picked it up just for me, AMAZING!!! I would highly recommend Phil to anyone looking to purchase their next vehicle. Everyone that I interacted with at Adamson was beyond professional and polite. After visiting 2 previous dealerships, one of those my husband and I had purchased 2 vehicles from, didn’t even compare to the experience we had with Phil.  The experience, knowledge and level of customer service he provided was remarkable. Keep up the great work Phil!!!!

name: Joseph Hollis
text: BUYER BEWARE!!! This review is for the service department. I tookk my truck in almost 2 weeks ago for a complete diagnostic.( On board computer - air conditioning etc) and was told that my car had no issues other than the air condition unit had a leak and my fan belt needing replacing. I allowed them to replace my fan belt and by the end of the day they told me my truck was no longer starting and then proceeded to tell me my engine computer was showing a bunch of error codes right after they told me everything was fine. They told me it was a timing chain which is extemely fishy considering they told me everything was fine. They supposedley had and engine guy look at the car all this week and I have yet to hear anything back from them further raising suspicison. They have made some many promises and have not fulfilled one to me. This is the worst car experince I have ever had. PLease dont use the service department.

resp.text: I am so sorry for your experience. I do understand that you brought this into our service department after purchasing somewhere else. Unfortunately sometimes with the age of the vehicle it can slow the diagnostic process and with no previous history of repairs this can take time. I will be sure and have someone contact you today with an update.

text:
Awful service department.
Took my car here to get the recall issues dealt with. We called to make an appointment and they said no appointments necessary just go in be ask for Brad. Well we went online and made an appointment anyways to make sure. The appointment was made 2 weeks in advance,  I brought my car in for 9am (when they open) and was told to come back around closing business hours. I never got a single phone call all day which is fine. I call around 3 to see if it's done. Told I would be called back but no one did. Called twice more around 4:30 and was finally told they didn't have a chance to work on my car. Never would have known my car hadn't even been touched because no one bothered to call me to let me know what the status  was. No apologies or offer to get me a back up car to drive because they needed it the next day and couldn't guarantee they would have time to do it then either. Had I not called I wouldn't have had a car and they would have closed without telling me it was or wasn't done. Terrible customer service.

If that doesn't make me not want to go back then I don't know what does. She didn't apologize or acknowledge the fact that she backed into my freaking car. My car is fine but after this service that I scheduled this might be it for me going to them.

Every other time they're fine tho I guess. But then again I've only been 3 times so, yea.

name: Ryan Harrison
text: We wanted to test drive a used vehicle, when we show up we end up waiting 30 minutes and they put us in a new vehicle instead, not to mention the back door handle was broken, very embarrassing for them, I would hope. We were not pleased with this bait and switch. We took out business elsewhere.

resp.text: Mr. Harrison, I apologize on our behalf for your less than pleasant experience. Our aim is to provide an unparalleled buying process for our customers and I’m as disappointed as you are that we’ve missed our mark. I will use this as a training opportunity with all parties involved to prevent a future occurrence. I welcome your feedback and would love to have open dialogue with you about your experience in hopes to enhance yours and future customers’ experiences with Adamson Ford. Please contact me via email at rhoward@adamsonford.com or by phone at 205-271-4730 at your convenience. Regards, Robert Howard, General Sales Manager.

name: Chuck Thomason
text: Overall I have been pleased with Adamson Ford.  Considering I have purchased an Explorer, (2) EDGE Limited's, and most recently a 2014 F150 4X4 w/ Off Road Package from them.  Not to mention they handle all my service work.  It is with my F150 purchase were I am becoming more than frustrated and if not dealt with at this dealership will be moving any and all my business ASAP!  My F150 has 23K miles on it which are almost all highway miles.  Complained about the truck vibrating at speeds over 70 mph which has yet to be fixed or even addressed to my knowledge.  I also have a vibration when braking and was told my rotors need to be turned at a cost to me of about a 170 bucks.  Now I have owned many a car/truck and have never had to turn the rotors after only 23K miles of usage.  In fact, I don't think I have ever had to turn rotors on a car/truck I have purchased since I had a real job.  I am not sure if this dealership is willing to lose my business over 166 bucks, but I am damn sure willing to move it for that amount.  FORD - recognize you have an issue as this same complaint has been posted a number of times.

Terrible their after the sale service is horrid at best they hang up on you never return calls guve you other dead end numbers to call back at a later time worst exp.ive ever had I bought a barely used truck which had been on their lit over 30 days .When I returned home to Florida
After waiting 21 days I had not received the info to have my tag transferred now after months of wasted phone calls they tell me they don't have a title nor does the party whom they purchased from almost 5 months later and i have a new truck i still cant legally drive ...Ok I wanted to update this to let everyone know several months later and they rectified the situation and gave a very sincere apology for all the trouble.I was also able to get a tag finally .Also I want to say that my salseman Phillip was great my only issues at all here were the title thing and their front desk could be better the communication was the only other negative .

name: sjstrick0124 x
text: My daughter bought her first vehicle from Adamson Ford 3 months ago. She was sure to search for a car that had a carfax and found several she liked online. We live over 100 miles from Adamson Ford and probably could have bought a car a lot closer...but because of the online reviews...she chose Adamson. Well this week, she had to have her entire brake system replaced at the local Ford dealership. They told her that the underside of her car was completely rusted out. This happens when cars are from Northern regions where they use salt on the roads to melt ice....or beach towns where there is natural salt in the air. in places like THAT....it is standard practice for a mechanic to check the underside of a car. My daughter's car was a late model 2014. The vehicle was most likely purchased at auction and came from another area in the US outside of Alabama. She was not expecting to have to pay for  new brakes and other rusted out parts on the bottom of her car. She called Adamson Ford about it and they said it was not their problem. Typical! They are nice and polite BEFORE you buy from them....but if you have a problem they change mighty quick. This was my daughter's very first vehicle. She tried to ask all the right questions and STILL got burned. No help from THIS dealership! And worse...no acknowledgement that they did not check the bottom of the car before selling it to an unsuspecting 21 yr. old kid. Yeah...I am one angry parent! Shame on Adamson Ford. We will NEVER use you again. You COULD have helped with the cost a little. But once you made the deal...you abandoned your customer!

text: I just got home from buying a 2013 Ford Pickup from Adamson Ford and wanted to share some details of my experience with them. My first contact with Adamson Ford was on their internet site. The internet personnel were all very cordial and accommodating. They knew the answers to all my questions and answered them very quickly! When I decided exactly what I wanted I was invited to come in and sign the necessary forms to complete my purchase. When I arrived, I was greeted by the salesman and shown the vehicle. My salesman had the keys for the truck and I test drove it. Matt was my salesman. He answered all my questions and addressed all my concerns. The questions that he wasn’t sure about, he was able to get prompt answers for. Everyone that I spoke with at the dealership was extremely friendly and accommodating. I am impressed with Adamson’s sales team and will send them all the business that I can! They are great folks and I will surely be back to deal with them in the future!!!!

name: Josh Adkins
text: I’ve been getting my F150 serviced at Adamson Ford for about a year now.  Recently, while I had a very good friend working there, I purchased a promotional service package. Shortly after that....I feel, that she was wrongfully terminated from her position due to another female employee being “personal”. NOT ONLY did they deny my service when I went back for my scheduled truck oil change/ tire rotation, but other current employees (which are also friends of mine and very good people) were asked to not associate with me! I am FULLY aware ANY business has the right to deny someone their service, however Adamson Ford’s motto is #AlwaysAdamson #AlwaysFamily and I’m sure I wouldn’t be the first to tell you that it was NOT how I was treated that day due to these circumstances. I have been in the car business for years at 2 different dealerships and I encourage anyone that is in the market that wants to have a great experience in purchasing a like-new/used vehicle or needs quality service to PLEASE contact me.

text:
Adamson is terrible ! They have nasty attitudes and usually do not know what they are doing . I get the run around everytime I go; no one can ever provide direct answers or resolutions for situations . Jessica acts like she doesn’t want to work there and George the supposed “service manager” fails to comply with Official Ford Motor Letters went out .

After calling for a month checking on my recall position with no answers as to when I could drop my car off or when parts would be in , knowing and understanding that I was leaving for the holidays ...they decide to call me the day that  I’m boarding my plane to go home from school . Being in california I told them there was no way I could get them my car and turn my rental in .... they insisted they’d begin to start charging me . Unacceptable . Called corporate, they said it was in the offices hands several times and each time everyone had an attitude . Now as stated earlier I have an official letter from Ford saying they are not to begin charging for the rental UNTIL they have my car ,AND my repairs are complete, not until 7 days AFTER my car repairs are complete are they to begin charging .

Do better !

name: Rebecca McCay
text:
Can’t even patch a tire!

After many frustrating experiences at Adamson, this was the final straw. I have been a customer of Adamson for years out of sheer connivence to my house. This past week I took my car to get my tires aired up and was told by my service advisor that I had a nail in it. They told me it was an easy patch and I was sent on my way. A day later I walked out to my car to head to work and my tire was completely flat! Turns out they just removed the nail and aired it up and sent me on my way. I came to a ford dealer expecting to receive a dealership experience but obviously customer service is not what this dealership prides themselves on. Only visit this dealership if you want half assed work and mediocre service.

name: Ronnie Sanford
text: They did the paper work but I asked them to add my wife's name and customer service said it was to much trouble for them to change. Upon purchase when given the key I had to ask for the second set. They said there wasn't one and the fob I received had no battery in it. I bought a battery and it still doesn't work. I ask if they would give me a full tank of gas they said no only $10 Not a good experience.

They told me that since Ford had previously replaced my battery under warranty, the battery was not covered by warranty. name: Junior Wolff
text:
Filled out form on KBB to sell my Hummer H2. This was my first time using this option.

Once I put info based on my assessment of condition I submitted the form.

About 15 mins later I received a call from Mathew at Adamson Ford. This was the second call so the KBB system works.

Mathew asked me to give them a shot to see if they could meet or exceed the KBB offer that was sent to me.

I drive it to Adamson and meet Mathew 15 mins later they exceeded the KBB offer quote and I even negotiated a ride home. Cannot beat that for service.

name: Inger Jackson
text: Very courteous and professional.  There was no pressure and I got exactly what I wanted

name: Gina Reynolds
text:
My grandfather owned a dealership my whole life (I’m 30) up until 3 yrs ago when he sold it for retirement. My father managed the parts department there up until 2 years ago (because the new owners were crooks & he couldn’t stand to work with them any longer). Since, my sister bought a car from Adamson & was very happy with her experience. So in December, I decided I’d start getting my oil changes there. I work @ UAB so it was convenient around my work hrs. My 1st experience was great! The guy that took care of me made sure the guy that drives the shuttle got me to work by 7:30. I picked up my car & paid leaving as a happy customer. My 2nd experience wasn’t so great.
I decided I’d get my tires rotated as well. A different man took my order & I went inside to sign up for the shuttle service. That same man comes in & openly complains about how several people are out with the flu & says “this is just going to be a great day” in an annoyed, sarcastic tone. As I’m signing up for the shuttle, the guy that drives said, “shuttle rides don’t start until 8”. To that I responded, “The guy that was here last time made sure I was at UAB in time to clock in & you were the one that drove me”. He said, “that should be fine as long as a lot of people don’t sign up”, & then after asking if I should walk 15 minutes later, he finally drove me (10 minutes after asking). Mind you, I didn’t have that problem at all the 1st time. As I’m working I get a call from them saying “Ma’am when we were rotating your tires we noticed that they are in big need of changing. Can we put on new tires for you?” He didn’t expect me to not be naïve & mindlessly say yes (being a single young female). I asked, “How much would that be” & he said, “Oh uh…$1,600”. I said, ”Absolutely not!” & instead, took my car to a place in my hometown & got 4 top brand, brand new for $950.
Last week I decided to give them another shot thinking if that guy was there that served me the 1st time, it should be okay. I saw him, but was served by a man I hadn’t seen before. I ordered an oil change & tire rotation. I avoided the hassle of the shuttle & made the 15 min walk to work. I got a call from a female saying “when we were rotating your tires we noticed a nail in one of them & if we took it out the hole would be too big to patch, can we replace that tire?” I, of course, said no & to that she said, “okay well we can’t rotate your tires then”. I told her that was fine. But I thought the whole thing was strange because I hadn’t once received a “low tire pressure” warning. When I went to pick up my car I noticed on their write up they documented the nail. So I took my car to my parents so dad & his friend could look. NO NAIL! I tried calling the following day to speak with the manager, & the lady that I spoke with was rude, & on top of that, REFUSED to give me her name. Apparently, they don’t have a general manager, they just have a manager per department. I wanted to be fair thinking maybe the head guy didn’t know about his workers, but if it’s the manager of the parts department, they know, which is why I’m turning here. I don’t think it’s fair to try to screw people over to get more money, my grandfather didn’t run his business that way. & the best thing I can do is caution other people from going. At least to the parts department.
